meanings.definition: The quality or state of being violable.
meanings.sent1: The violablenesses of the rules made them easy to break.
meanings.sent2: She studied the violablenesses of the ancient laws.
meanings.sent3: The violablenesses of the cake made it irresistible to the hungry children.
meanings.sent4: His trust in her was as fragile as the violablenesses of a delicate glass sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The violablenesses of the rope were evident as it frayed under the weight.

meanings.sent1: The violablenesses of the agreements were being discussed in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: They debated the violablenesses of the various contracts.
meanings.sent3: The violablenesses of the flowers in the garden added a colorful touch.
meanings.sent4: The violablenesses of their friendship were tested during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The violablenesses of the ropes were evident as they strained under the heavy load.
